bibliographic_data.title: A BLE RSSI ranking based indoor positioning system for generic smartphones

algorithms: RSSI ranking algorithm for cross-device normalization
Weighted least squares for ranking trilateration
theoretical_contributions: RSSI ranking theory for device-independent positioning
Statistical analysis of RSSI ranking stability

breakthrough_points: First systematic application of ranking theory to BLE indoor positioning
Cross-device compatibility with <15% variation between smartphones
Generic smartphone deployment without device-specific calibration
39% improvement over traditional RSSI-based positioning methods

datasets_used: Custom BLE positioning dataset with 5 different smartphone models
20 BLE beacon deployment with systematic positioning
baseline_comparisons: Raw RSSI distance estimation (4.2m average error)

specific_applications: BLE vs WiFi positioning comparison for indoor sensing applications
Relative signal analysis methodology applicable to WiFi CSI ranking
Cross-device normalization techniques for wireless sensing
Generic deployment strategies for device-free sensing systems

strengths: Innovative ranking-based approach eliminates device-specific calibration requirements
Strong cross-device compatibility with consistent performance across smartphone models
Practical deployment advantages for generic smartphone-based positioning
Significant 39% improvement over traditional RSSI-based positioning methods
Comprehensive experimental validation with multiple device types
Mathematical framework provides theoretical foundation for ranking-based positioning
limitations: Limited to indoor environments with dense BLE beacon deployment
Requires minimum 20 beacons for 1000 square meter coverage area
2.3m average error still relatively high for precision positioning applications
No evaluation of positioning accuracy in dynamic environments
Limited comparison with WiFi-based positioning alternatives
Beacon deployment cost and maintenance considerations not thoroughly addressed
future_directions: Integration with WiFi CSI for hybrid indoor positioning systems
Extension to outdoor and semi-outdoor environments
Dynamic beacon selection algorithms for optimal positioning accuracy
Machine learning enhancement of ranking-based positioning algorithms
Real-time tracking and trajectory estimation capabilities
Integration with IMU sensors for improved positioning robustness

wifi_har_relevance.methodological_contribution: Ranking-based signal analysis applicable to WiFi CSI relative measurements
wifi_har_relevance.cross_technology_insights: Cross-device normalization techniques transferable to WiFi sensing
wifi_har_relevance.positioning_comparison: Provides baseline for comparing WiFi-based positioning with BLE approaches
adaptation_requirements: WiFi CSI ranking methodology for cross-device consistency
Relative signal strength analysis for device-free sensing
Generic deployment strategies for wireless sensing infrastructure
